TopicTitle: I Think I May Have Gone Too Far...

Articles.Content:
![trt4muF.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/trt4muF.jpg)

**this is the time i went too far. This is the Titan. This guy is 2194.1 tons... It honestly frightens me. Jeb stands at its base triumphantly, only he is brave enough to pilot this sonovabitch**

![PcgiFLp.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/PcgiFLp.jpg)

**Sitting on The Launch pad**

![6PZsXiS.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/6PZsXiS.jpg)

**Here is the biggest surprise of the mission. It actually didn't blow up. Also this is the first test flight of it**

![vDDPv8R.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/vDDPv8R.jpg)

**This is dropping off the first stage (It is three internal Boosters)**

![pEBxnx3.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/pEBxnx3.jpg)

**Dropping off the Main stage, it did the main bulk lifting**

![X4KBXcJ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/X4KBXcJ.jpg)

**It is at this point that i begin to believe. WILL IT WORK?!**

![paxXh4x.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/paxXh4x.jpg)

**BOOM! As i decoupled the previous stage it blew up behind me. Worried that i had damaged the ship i frantically look around it. Luckily the boom was just parts from the previous stage**

![AsPNcn3.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/AsPNcn3.jpg)

**The ships Interplanetary Section**

![XCfm9z1.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/XCfm9z1.jpg)

**this stage has about 7700 delta V if i calculated it properly and im pretty sure Jeb likes it.**
Woah that's a big one very nice RedCow, explosive staging is best staging ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

That behemoth looks like it can land a laythe colony in one launch. Don't know the dV requirements, but looks like enough.

Theredcow +rep
Niether do I. I'm not one of those people who works out the specific strength of a ship. I'm more of a lets see if it works kind of guy

Nice work on that beast ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Looks promising to lift some tonnes of payload to the most destinations !

I really like the Kerbodyne/mk3 styling of the aft section, it reminds me of Soyuz/Vostok which is appropriate for something that huge. Well done, and nice sequence of pictures! So, does it have a mission in mind or are you still in proof-of-concept stage? With that many NERVA engines and the right hookups I think you could get a Class-E asteroid under tow.

> 
> I really like the Kerbodyne/mk3 styling of the aft section, it reminds me of Soyuz/Vostok which is appropriate for something that huge. Well done, and nice sequence of pictures! So, does it have a mission in mind or are you still in proof-of-concept stage? With that many NERVA engines and the right hookups I think you could get a Class-E asteroid under tow.

Its still in the proof of concept stage, but i think i might use it to bring a class E asteroid into an orbit, then make a colony on it. If not that then maybe send something big to jool

> 
> -snip- ****

Don't worry, I have one 4 times as large ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) it's not too far... Nice job tho. Would rep if i wasn't out of rep for the next 24 hours.
WOW! IT DWARFS MY FAR-LANDER SERIES! You would get way more space delta-V if you had an orange tank and four nukes. It gets about 10,000 delta-v.

> 
> WOW! IT DWARFS MY FAR-LANDER SERIES! You would get way more space delta-V if you had an orange tank and four nukes. It gets about 10,000 delta-v.

that stage in the last screen shot has an orange tank on it along with a load of other fuel tanks + all those nukes
And? Which is easier to launch into space?
Wow. It works AND looks very clean and nice. Great work. Also, such a booster should prove useful in 1.0, when you need to lift large mining and processing platforms.
